cards.name: Bee Sting
cards.text: Bee Sting deals 2 damage to any target.
cards.flavor:
Busy as a bumblebee, blistered as a goblin.
—Alaborn saying
cards.originalText: Bee Sting deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Channel
cards.text: Until end of turn, any time you could activate a mana ability, you may pay 1 life. If you do, add {C}.

rulings.text: Once your life total is 0, you can't pay any more life, even if you've somehow not lost the game yet.

cards.originalText: Until end of turn, any time you could activate a mana ability, you may pay 1 life. If you do, add {1} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Citanul Druid
cards.text: Whenever an opponent casts an artifact spell, put a +1/+1 counter on Citanul Druid.

rulings.text: In multiplayer games it affects all players.

cards.originalText: Whenever an opponent casts an artifact spell, put a +1/+1 counter on Citanul Druid.

cards.name: Crumble
cards.text: Destroy target artifact. It can't be regenerated. That artifact's controller gains life equal to its converted mana cost.

rulings.text: If the target artifact becomes illegal before resolution, the player does not gain any life.

cards.originalText: Destroy target artifact. It can't be regenerated. That artifact's controller gains life equal to its converted mana cost.

cards.name: Cyclone
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, put a wind counter on Cyclone, then sacrifice Cyclone unless you pay {G} for each wind counter on it. If you pay, Cyclone deals damage equal to the number of wind counters on it to each creature and each player.
cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, put a wind counter on Cyclone, then sacrifice Cyclone unless you pay {G} for each wind counter on it. If you pay, Cyclone deals damage equal to the number of wind counters on it to each creature and each player.

cards.name: Deathcoil Wurm
cards.text: You may have Deathcoil Wurm assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.

rulings.text: You can decide to assign damage to the defending player or planeswalker even if the blocking creature has protection from green or damage preventing effects on it.

When assigning combat damage, you choose whether you want to assign all damage to blocking creatures, or if you want to assign all of it to the player or planeswalker this creature is attacking. You can't split the damage assignment between them.
If blocked by a creature with banding, the defending player decides whether or not the damage is assigned "as though it weren't blocked".

cards.originalText: You may have Deathcoil Wurm assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.

cards.name: Drop of Honey
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, destroy the creature with the least power. It can't be regenerated. If two or more creatures are tied for least power, you choose one of them.
When there are no creatures on the battlefield, sacrifice Drop of Honey.

rulings.text: This card's ability is not targeted, so even untargetable creatures or those with Protection can be chosen.
If the creature with the least power has indestructible, the ability does nothing.
If there are multiple creatures tied for least power and some but not all of them have indestructible, the ones with indestructible can't be chosen.

cards.originalText:
At the beginning of your upkeep, destroy the creature with the least power. It can't be regenerated. If two or more creatures are tied for least power, you choose one of them.
When there are no creatures on the battlefield, sacrifice Drop of Honey.

cards.name: Elite Cat Warrior
cards.text: Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
cards.flavor: "Hear that? No? That's a cat warrior."
cards.originalText: Forestwalk

cards.name: Fastbond
cards.text:
You may play any number of lands on each of your turns.
Whenever you play a land, if it wasn't the first land you played this turn, Fastbond deals 1 damage to you.

rulings.text: You take damage when you play a land using the "play a land" action. Such an action can be your regular "play a land", one enabled by Fastbond, or ones enabled through other effects.
You do not take damage when you "put a land onto the battlefield" through the effect of a spell or ability.

cards.originalText:
You may play any number of additional lands on each of your turns.
Whenever you play a land, if it wasn't the first land you played this turn, Fastbond deals 1 damage to you.

cards.name: Fog
cards.text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
cards.originalText: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.

cards.name: Force of Nature
cards.text:
Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, Force of Nature deals 8 damage to you unless you pay {G}{G}{G}{G}.
cards.originalText:
Trample (If this creature would deal enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it deal the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, Force of Nature deals 8 damage to you unless you pay {G}{G}{G}{G}.

cards.name: Gaea's Avenger
cards.text: Gaea's Avenger's power and toughness are each equal to 1 plus the number of artifacts your opponents control.

rulings.text: In multi-player games it counts artifacts of all opponents.

cards.originalText: Gaea's Avenger's power and toughness are each equal to 1 plus the number of artifacts your opponents control.

cards.name: Giant Growth
cards.text: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
cards.originalText: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

cards.name: Instill Energy
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can attack as though it had haste.
{0}: Untap enchanted creature. Activate this ability only during your turn and only once each turn.

rulings.text: If attached to an opponent's creature, you can untap their creature during your turn.
Instill Energy's untap ability will not untap the creature until it resolves. This means other spells and abilities can be used before it actually becomes untapped.

Any Auras (or other effects) which are on the creature that would cause it to not be untapped (or have a cost to be untapped) during untap step do not in any way hinder or imply a cost to use this card's ability to untap once during the turn.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has haste.
{0}: Untap enchanted creature. Activate this ability only during your turn and only once each turn.

cards.name: Ironhoof Ox
cards.text: Ironhoof Ox can't be blocked by more than one creature.
cards.flavor: The good news is it's vegetarian. The bad news is it just doesn't like you.
cards.originalText: Ironhoof Ox can't be blocked by more than one creature.

cards.name: Kudzu
cards.text:
Enchant land
When enchanted land becomes tapped, destroy it. That land's controller attaches Kudzu to a land of their choice.

rulings.text: You can move it to any other player's land whenever you get to move it.
If Kudzu is destroyed directly, or the land is destroyed by a spell or ability, then Kudzu goes to the graveyard like any Aura would.
The controller of the destroyed land must attach it to another land if possible. If there are no valid choices, Kudzu is simply put into the graveyard.
Because the ability isn't targeted, the controller of the destroyed land may attach it to a land that can't be the target of abilities.

cards.originalText:
Enchant land
When enchanted land becomes tapped, destroy it. That land's controller attaches Kudzu to a land of his or her choice.

cards.name: Lifeforce
cards.text: {G}{G}: Counter target black spell.
cards.originalText: {G}{G}: Counter target black spell.

cards.name: Living Lands
cards.text: All Forests are 1/1 creatures that are still lands.

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

cards.originalText: All Forests are 1/1 creatures that are still lands.

cards.name: Radjan Spirit
cards.text: {T}: Target creature loses flying until end of turn.

rulings.text: Can be used on a creature without Flying with no effect.

cards.originalText: {T}: Target creature loses flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Regrowth
cards.text: Return target card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.originalText: Return target card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Sandstorm
cards.text: Sandstorm deals 1 damage to each attacking creature.
cards.flavor: Even the landscape turned against Sarsour, first rising up and pelting him, then rearranging itself so he could no longer find his way.
cards.originalText: Sandstorm deals 1 damage to each attacking creature.

cards.name: Scarwood Bandits
cards.text:
Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
{2}{G}, {T}: Unless an opponent pays {2}, gain control of target artifact for as long as Scarwood Bandits remains on the battlefield.
cards.originalText:
Forestwalk
{2}{G}, {T}: Unless target artifact's controller pays {2}, gain control of that artifact for as long as Scarwood Bandits remains on the battlefield.

cards.name: Scavenger Folk
cards.text: {G}, {T}, Sacrifice Scavenger Folk: Destroy target artifact.
cards.originalText: {G}, {T}, Sacrifice Scavenger Folk: Destroy target artifact.

cards.name: Southern Elephant
cards.flavor: While defending their southern borders, both the Wu and Shu kingdoms fought against the barbarians' trained elephants.

cards.name: Squall
cards.text: Squall deals 2 damage to each creature with flying.
cards.flavor:
"To-night the winds begin to rise . . .
The rooks are blown about the skies . . . ."
—Alfred, Lord Tennyson, In Memoriam
cards.originalText: Squall deals 2 damage to each creature with flying.

cards.name: Sylvan Tutor
cards.text: Search your library for a creature card and reveal that card. Shuffle your library, then put the card on top of it.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.originalText: Search your library for a creature card and reveal that card. Shuffle your library, then put the card on top of it.

cards.name: Titania's Song
cards.text: Each noncreature artifact loses all abilities and becomes an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost. If Titania's Song leaves the battlefield, this effect continues until end of turn.

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

cards.originalText: Each noncreature artifact loses its abilities and becomes an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost. If Titania's Song leaves the battlefield, this effect continues until end of turn.

cards.name: Tsunami
cards.text: Destroy all Islands.

cards.text: Trample
cards.originalText: Trample

cards.name: Whiptail Wurm
cards.flavor: It's hard to say for certain which end is more dangerous.

cards.name: Wild Ox
cards.text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
cards.flavor: It has the run of the swamps, and it knows it.
cards.originalText: Swampwalk

cards.name: Wood Elemental
cards.text:
As Wood Elemental enters the battlefield, sacrifice any number of untapped Forests.
Wood Elemental's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Forests sacrificed as it entered the battlefield.

rulings.text: The Forests are sacrificed to define the power/toughness of this card right before it enters the battlefield. You have to do this sacrifice no matter how this card enters the battlefield.

cards.originalText:
As Wood Elemental enters the battlefield, sacrifice any number of untapped Forests.
Wood Elemental's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Forests sacrificed as it entered the battlefield.

cards.name: Aesthir Glider
cards.text:
Flying
Aesthir Glider can't block.
cards.flavor:
"Sacrilege! A noble ally in life, made nothing more than a glorified kite in death!"
—Arna Kennerüd, skycaptain
cards.originalText:
Flying
Aesthir Glider can't block.

cards.name: Al-abara's Carpet
cards.text: {5}, {T}: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to you this turn by attacking creatures without flying.
cards.flavor: Al-abara simply laughed and lifted one finger, and the carpet carried her high out of our reach.
cards.originalText: {5}, {T}: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to you this turn by attacking creatures without flying.

cards.name: Alchor's Tomb
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Target permanent you control becomes the color of your choice. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
cards.originalText: {2}, {T}: Target permanent you control becomes the color of your choice.

cards.name: Amulet of Kroog
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
cards.flavor: Among the first allies Urza gained were the people of Kroog. As a sign of friendship, Urza gave the healers of the city potent amulets; afterwards, thousands journeyed to Kroog in hope of healing, greatly adding to the city's glory.
cards.originalText: {2}, {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

cards.name: Armageddon Clock
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a doom counter on Armageddon Clock.
At the beginning of your draw step, Armageddon Clock deals damage equal to the number of doom counters on it to each player.
{4}: Remove a doom counter from Armageddon Clock. Any player may activate this ability but only during any upkeep step.

rulings.text: Players can remove as many counters as they can pay for each turn.

cards.originalText:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a doom counter on Armageddon Clock.
At the beginning of your draw step, Armageddon Clock deals damage to each player equal to the number of doom counters on it.
{4}: Remove a doom counter from Armageddon Clock. Any player may activate this ability but only during any upkeep step.

cards.text: Sacrifice a creature: Add {C}{C}.
cards.originalText: Sacrifice a creature: Add {2} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Basalt Monolith
cards.text:
Basalt Monolith doesn't untap during your untap step.
{T}: Add {C}{C}{C}.
{3}: Untap Basalt Monolith.

rulings.text: It can be untapped as often as you can pay for it.

cards.originalText:
Basalt Monolith doesn't untap during your untap step.
{3}: Untap Basalt Monolith.
{T}: Add {3} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Book of Rass
cards.text: {2}, Pay 2 life: Draw a card.

rulings.text: You can't spend yourself to below zero life. You can't spend life you don't have.

cards.originalText: {2}, Pay 2 life: Draw a card.

cards.name: Bottle of Suleiman
cards.text: {1}, Sacrifice Bottle of Suleiman: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, create a 5/5 colorless Djinn artifact creature token with flying. If you lose the flip, Bottle of Suleiman deals 5 damage to you.

rulings.text: The coin is flipped on resolution and not on declaration of the ability.

cards.originalText: {1}, Sacrifice Bottle of Suleiman: Flip a coin. If you lose the flip, Bottle of Suleiman deals 5 damage to you. If you win the flip, put a 5/5 colorless Djinn artifact creature token with flying onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Brass Man
cards.text:
Brass Man doesn't untap during your untap step.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may pay {1}. If you do, untap Brass Man.

rulings.text: Reworded so that it triggers only once at beginning of upkeep, instead of being an activated ability usable any time during your upkeep. You can no longer make infinite combos with this ability.

cards.originalText:
Brass Man doesn't untap during your untap step.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may pay {1}. If you do, untap Brass Man.

cards.name: Bronze Horse

Trample
As long as you control another creature, prevent all damage that would be dealt to Bronze Horse by spells that target it.

Trample

cards.name: Candelabra of Tawnos
cards.text: {X}, {T}: Untap X target lands.
cards.flavor: Tawnos learned quickly from Urza that utter simplicity often led to wondrous, yet subtle utility.

rulings.text: You may untap your opponent's lands if desired.
Can be used on an untapped land.
This is not mana ability. It is a normal ability and it will resolve along with other spells and abilities on the stack. The lands untap during resolution.

cards.originalText: {X}, {T}: Untap X target lands.

cards.name: Celestial Sword
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Target creature you control gets +3/+3 until end of turn. Its controller sacrifices it at the beginning of the next end step.
cards.flavor:
"So great is its power, only the chosen can wield it and live."
—Avram Garrisson, Leader of the Knights of Stromgald
cards.originalText: {3}, {T}: Target creature you control gets +3/+3 until end of turn. Its controller sacrifices it at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.name: Clay Statue
cards.text: {2}: Regenerate Clay Statue.
cards.flavor: Tawnos won fame as Urza's greatest assistant. After he created these warriors, Urza ended his apprenticeship, promoting him directly to the rank of master.
cards.originalText: {2}: Regenerate Clay Statue.

cards.name: Clockwork Avian
cards.text:
Flying
Clockwork Avian enters the battlefield with four +1/+0 counters on it.
At end of combat, if Clockwork Avian attacked or blocked this combat, remove a +1/+0 counter from it.
{X}, {T}: Put up to X +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Avian. This ability can't cause the total number of +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Avian to be greater than four. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

rulings.text: Loses a counter even if it is affected by a Fog-like effect which prevents it from dealing damage.
Can attack or block even if it has no counters.
If the ability to add counters resolves when there are already the maximum number of counters on it, any counters over the maximum are simply not added.

Flying
Clockwork Avian enters the battlefield with four +1/+0 counters on it.

rulings.text: Loses a counter even if it is affected by a Fog-like effect which prevents it from dealing damage.
Can attack or block even if it has no counters.

Clockwork Swarm enters the battlefield with four +1/+0 counters on it.
Clockwork Swarm can't be blocked by Walls.

cards.name: Colossus of Sardia
cards.text:
Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
Colossus of Sardia doesn't untap during your untap step.
{9}: Untap Colossus of Sardia. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.
cards.flavor: Buried under a thin layer of dirt, it was known for centuries as Mount Sardia.

rulings.text: The ability that untaps it during your upkeep has been returned to an activated ability. There is no restriction on how many times it can be untapped during your upkeep with this ability.

cards.originalText:
Trample (If this creature would deal enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it deal the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)
Colossus of Sardia doesn't untap during your untap step.
{9}: Untap Colossus of Sardia. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

cards.name: Coral Helm
cards.text: {3}, Discard a card at random: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.originalText: {3}, Discard a card at random: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Cyclopean Tomb
cards.text:
{2}, {T}: Put a mire counter on target non-Swamp land. That land is a Swamp for as long as it has a mire counter on it. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.
When Cyclopean Tomb is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, at the beginning of each of your upkeeps for the rest of the game, remove all mire counters from a land that a mire counter was put onto with Cyclopean Tomb but that a mire counter has not been removed from with Cyclopean Tomb.

rulings.text: Will not add or remove Snow Supertype to or from a land.

After leaving the battlefield, the ability triggers during each of your upkeeps for the rest of the game. As it resolves, you must remove a mire counter from a land that had a mire counter put on it by that instance of Cyclopean Tomb, but it doesn't matter where the mire counter you remove came from. For instance, you could remove mire counters that were put on the land by Gilder Bairn.
The land remains a Swamp as long as it has a mire counter on it. This effect is not tied to the Tomb remaining on the battlefield.

cards.originalText:
{2}, {T}: Put a mire counter on target non-Swamp land. That land is a Swamp for as long as it has a mire counter on it. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.
When Cyclopean Tomb is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, at the beginning of each of your upkeeps for the rest of the game, remove all mire counters from a land that a mire counter was put onto with Cyclopean Tomb but that a mire counter has not been removed from with Cyclopean Tomb.

cards.name: Diabolic Machine
cards.text: {3}: Regenerate Diabolic Machine.
cards.flavor:
"The bolts of our ballistae smashed into the monstrous thing, but our hopes died in our chests as its gears continued turning."
—Sevti Mukul, The Fall of Alsoor
cards.originalText: {3}: Regenerate Diabolic Machine.

cards.name: Dragon Engine
cards.text: {2}: Dragon Engine gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Those who believed the city of Kroog would never fall to Mishra's forces severely underestimated the might of his war machines.
cards.originalText: {2}: Dragon Engine gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.text: {2}, {T}: Untap target attacking creature you control. Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by that creature this turn.
cards.originalText: {2}, {T}: Untap target attacking creature you control. Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by that creature this turn.

cards.name: Ebony Rhino
cards.text: Trample
cards.flavor:
"That Rhino would fetch us a tidy sum, Joven. Perhaps it's time to make it ours."
—Chandler
cards.originalText: Trample

cards.name: Floodwater Dam
cards.text: {X}{X}{1}, {T}: Tap X target lands.
cards.flavor: Viscerid dams may be of living creatures as well as bones and mud.
cards.originalText: {X}{X}{1}, {T}: Tap X target lands.

cards.name: Flying Carpet
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
cards.originalText: {2}, {T}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Gauntlet of Might
cards.text:
Red creatures get +1/+1.
Whenever a Mountain is tapped for mana, its controller adds an additional {R}.

rulings.text: Dual lands which have Mountain as one of their types produce an extra red mana when tapped for either color.

cards.originalText:
Red creatures get +1/+1.
Whenever a Mountain is tapped for mana, its controller adds {R} to his or her mana pool (in addition to the mana the land produces).

cards.name: Glasses of Urza
cards.text: {T}: Look at target player's hand.
cards.originalText: {T}: Look at target player's hand.

cards.name: Grapeshot Catapult
cards.text: {T}: Grapeshot Catapult deals 1 damage to target creature with flying.
cards.flavor: For years scholars debated whether these were Urza's or Mishra's creations. Recent research suggests they were invented by the brothers' original master, Tocasia, and that both used these devices.
cards.originalText: {T}: Grapeshot Catapult deals 1 damage to target creature with flying.

cards.name: Horn of Deafening
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt by target creature this turn.
cards.flavor: "A blast, an echo . . . then silence."
cards.originalText: {2}, {T}: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt by target creature this turn.

cards.name: Ice Cauldron
cards.text:
{X}, {T}: Put a charge counter on Ice Cauldron and exile a nonland card from your hand. You may cast that card for as long as it remains exiled. Note the type and amount of mana spent to pay this activation cost. Activate this ability only if there are no charge counters on Ice Cauldron.
{T}, Remove a charge counter from Ice Cauldron: Add Ice Cauldron's last noted type and amount of mana. Spend this mana only to cast the last card exiled with Ice Cauldron.

rulings.text: The Cauldron counts only mana spent on it. It doesn't see the value of X, so isn't affected by cost reductions. Thus, if you spent {C}{C}{R}{R} on X, you get {C}{C}{R}{R} later even if X was 6.
Cards which are not actually in your hand can't be exiled by the Ice Cauldron.
If multiple cards are exiled by the Cauldron, the mana can only be used for the card that was exiled by the Cauldron when the most recent charge counter was put there.

The mana put in the Cauldron can only be used to cast the given spell, but you can add additional mana to a spell. This means you can pay part of the cost on one turn and the rest of it on the next turn.

You do not have to use any mana from the Cauldron when casting the spell if you don't want to. You don't even have to tap the Cauldron and draw the mana, you can just cast the spell using mana from somewhere else.
If multiple cards are exiled by the Cauldron, any one of them can be cast.
If the ability to exile a card with the Cauldron is countered, you do not lose the card since it is exiled during resolution.

It is possible to have more than one card exiled by the Cauldron. You can tap the Cauldron to remove the charge counter and whatever mana is on it but leave the card there. Later, you can tap it and put in mana and a charge counter to add another card.
X can be zero. This places a zero mana counter on the Cauldron.
You can only cast the spell when you could legally cast it normally. So no casting a sorcery on your opponent's turn.
The mana can be used to pay for additional costs to cast the spell.
If the Cauldron leaves the battlefield, you can still cast any cards it exiled as though they were in your hand. You just no longer have access to the mana you charged the Cauldron with.
Tapping the Cauldron for the mana is a mana ability.
Produces mana of the last type used to put a counter on itself, not via any other charge counters.

cards.originalText:
{X}, {T}: Put a charge counter on Ice Cauldron and exile a nonland card from your hand. You may cast that card for as long as it remains exiled. Note the type and amount of mana spent to pay this activation cost. Activate this ability only if there are no charge counters on Ice Cauldron.
{T}, Remove a charge counter from Ice Cauldron: Add Ice Cauldron's last noted type and amount of mana to your mana pool. Spend this mana only to cast the last card exiled with Ice Cauldron.

cards.name: Icy Manipulator
cards.text: {1}, {T}: Tap target artifact, creature, or land.

rulings.text: Once a player announces that they're casting a spell or activating an ability, no player may take other actions until the spell or ability has been paid for. Notably, other players can't try to tap that player's permanents to stop them from paying {T} or to stop them from producing enough mana.

cards.originalText: {1}, {T}: Tap target artifact, creature, or land.

cards.name: Jade Monolith
cards.text: {1}: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to target creature this turn, that source deals that damage to you instead.
cards.originalText: {1}: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to target creature this turn, that source deals that damage to you instead.

cards.name: Juggernaut
cards.text:
Juggernaut attacks each combat if able.
Juggernaut can't be blocked by Walls.
cards.flavor: We had taken refuge in a small cave, thinking the entrance was too narrow for it to follow. To our horror, its gigantic head smashed into the mountainside, ripping itself a new entrance.

rulings.text: If Juggernaut can't attack for any reason (such as being tapped or having come under that player's control that turn), then it doesn't attack. If there's a cost associated with having it attack, its controller isn't forced to pay that cost, so it doesn't have to attack in that case either.

cards.originalText:
Juggernaut attacks each turn if able.
Juggernaut can't be blocked by Walls.

cards.name: Kormus Bell
cards.text: All Swamps are 1/1 black creatures that are still lands.

rulings.text: The lands are both lands and creatures at the same time. They are affected by anything that affects either permanent type.
It affects Swamps controlled by any and all players.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

cards.originalText: All Swamps are 1/1 creatures that are still lands.

cards.name: Library of Leng
cards.text:
You have no maximum hand size.
If an effect causes you to discard a card, discard it, but you may put it on top of your library instead of into your graveyard.

rulings.text: This effect has no effect on the cards being put into the graveyard from a library, because they are not "discarded".
You can't use the Library of Leng ability to place a discarded card on top of your library when you discard a card as a cost, because costs aren't effects.
The discard triggers anything else that triggers on discards.
You can look at a randomly discarded card before deciding where it goes.

The ability applies any time a spell or ability has you discard as part of its effect. It does not matter if you or your opponent control the spell or ability. The discard is forced because it is an effect.

If more than one card is discarded due to a single effect, the Library allows you to decide whether or not to use it on each of the cards. You get to decide the order the cards are placed on the library if more than one goes there.
Since the card goes directly to the library, the card is not revealed unless the spell or ability requiring the discard specifically says it is.
The ability replaces the normal discard action with a discard action that puts the card on the library instead of the graveyard.

If multiple effects modify your hand size, apply them in timestamp order. For example, if you put Null Profusion (an enchantment that says your maximum hand size is two) onto the battlefield and then put Library of Leng onto the battlefield, you'll have no maximum hand size. However, if those permanents entered the battlefield in the opposite order, your maximum hand size would be two.

cards.originalText:
You have no maximum hand size.
If an effect causes you to discard a card, discard it, but you may put it on top of your library instead of into your graveyard.

cards.name: Living Wall
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{1}: Regenerate Living Wall.
cards.flavor: Some fiendish mage had created a horrifying wall of living flesh, patched together from a jumble of still-recognizable body parts. As we sought to hew our way through it, some unknown power healed the gaping wounds we cut, denying us passage.
cards.originalText:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{1}: Regenerate Living Wall.

cards.name: Mana Matrix
cards.text: Instant and enchantment spells you cast cost up to {2} less to cast.

rulings.text: Multiple Matrices are cumulative. Two will reduce the cost by up to {4}, and so on.
Only affects its controller, not all players.
Only works on instants and enchantments. It does not work on sorceries.
Only reduces the generic mana portion of a spell's cost. If the cost does not include generic mana or includes less than {2}, you get a reduced or null effect from this card.

cards.originalText: Instant and enchantment spells you cast cost up to {2} less to cast.

cards.name: Mana Vault
cards.text:
Mana Vault doesn't untap during your untap step.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may pay {4}. If you do, untap Mana Vault.
At the beginning of your draw step, if Mana Vault is tapped, it deals 1 damage to you.
{T}: Add {C}{C}{C}.
cards.originalText:
Mana Vault doesn't untap during your untap step.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may pay {4}. If you do, untap Mana Vault.
At the beginning of your draw step, if Mana Vault is tapped, it deals 1 damage to you.
{T}: Add {3} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Mightstone
cards.text: Attacking creatures get +1/+0.
cards.flavor: While exploring the sacred cave of Koilos with his brother Mishra and their master Tocasia, Urza fell behind in the Hall of Tagsin, where he discovered the remarkable Mightstone.

rulings.text: The +1/+0 applies to attacking creatures from all players.

cards.originalText: Attacking creatures get +1/+0.

cards.name: Naked Singularity
cards.text:
Cumulative upkeep {3} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
If tapped for mana, Plains produce {R}, Islands produce {G}, Swamps produce {W}, Mountains produce {U}, and Forests produce {B} instead of any other type.

rulings.text: The ability generates a replacement effect.

If a player uses a text-changing effect to make a land type be listed as producing two different colors, the player tapping the land for mana can choose to produce mana of either color. But if it produces more than one mana, all mana is of the same color.
If a land has more than one basic land type, the player tapping the land for mana can choose to produce mana of either color. But if it produces more than one mana, all mana is of the same color.

cards.originalText:
Cumulative upkeep {3} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
If tapped for mana, Plains produce {R}, Islands produce {G}, Swamps produce {W}, Mountains produce {U}, and Forests produce {B} instead of any other type.

cards.name: Obelisk of Undoing
cards.text: {6}, {T}: Return target permanent you both own and control to your hand.
cards.flavor: The Battle of Tomakul taught Urza not to rely on fickle reinforcements.
cards.originalText: {6}, {T}: Return target permanent you own and control to your hand.

cards.name: Obsianus Golem
cards.flavor:
"The foot stone is connected to the ankle stone, the ankle stone is connected to the leg stone . . ."
—"Song of the Artificer"

cards.name: Onulet
cards.text: When Onulet dies, you gain 2 life.
cards.flavor: An early inspiration for Urza, Tocasia's Onulets contained magical essences that could be cannibalized after they stopped functioning.
cards.originalText: When Onulet is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you gain 2 life.

cards.name: Pentagram of the Ages
cards.text: {4}, {T}: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
cards.flavor: "Take this item, for instance. How would it destroy us, Relicbane?" —Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi Machinist
cards.originalText: {4}, {T}: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

cards.name: Planar Gate
cards.text: Creature spells you cast cost up to {2} less to cast.
cards.flavor: Nireya reached through the Gate, sensing the energies trapped beyond.

rulings.text: Multiple Gates are cumulative. Two will reduce the cost by up to {4}, and so on.
Only works for its controller, not all players.
Only reduces the generic mana portion of a spell's cost. If the cost does not include generic mana or includes less than {2}, you get a reduced or null effect from this card.
Works on all spells with the type Creature, even if the spell has another type like Artifact or Enchantment.

cards.originalText: Creature spells you cast cost up to {2} less to cast.

cards.name: Primal Clay
cards.text: As Primal Clay enters the battlefield, it becomes your choice of a 3/3 artifact creature, a 2/2 artifact creature with flying, or a 1/6 Wall artifact creature with defender in addition to its other types. (A creature with defender can't attack.)

rulings.text: In zones other than the battlefield, this creature card is 0/0.

If another permanent enters the battlefield as a copy of this creature, the controller of that permanent will get to make a new choice. The copy won't necessarily have the same power, toughness, and abilities as the original.
If a creature that's already on the battlefield becomes a copy of this creature, it copies the power, toughness, and abilities that were chosen for this creature as it entered the battlefield.

cards.originalText: As Primal Clay enters the battlefield, it becomes your choice of a 3/3 artifact creature, a 2/2 artifact creature with flying, or a 1/6 Shapeshifter Wall artifact creature with defender.

cards.name: Rakalite
cards.text: {2}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn. Return Rakalite to its owner's hand at the beginning of the next end step.
cards.flavor: Urza was the first to understand that the war would not be lost for lack of power, but for lack of troops.

rulings.text: Only returns to your hand if it is still on the battlefield at the end of the turn. If it leaves the battlefield, it does not return.
Can be used any number of times during the turn before it leaves the battlefield.

cards.originalText: {2}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn. Return Rakalite to its owner's hand at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.name: Ring of Renewal
cards.text: {5}, {T}: Discard a card at random, then draw two cards.
cards.flavor: To the uninitiated, the Ring of Renewal is merely an oddity. For those fluent in the wielding of magic, however, it is a source of great knowledge.
cards.originalText: {5}, {T}: Discard a card at random, then draw two cards.

cards.name: Scarecrow
cards.text: {6}, {T}: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to you this turn by creatures with flying.
cards.flavor: There was more malice in its button eyes than should have been possible in something that had never known life.

rulings.text: Even prevents non-combat damage from flying creatures.

cards.originalText: {6}, {T}: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to you this turn by creatures with flying.

cards.name: Shapeshifter
cards.text:
As Shapeshifter enters the battlefield, choose a number between 0 and 7.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may choose a number between 0 and 7.
Shapeshifter's power is equal to the last chosen number and its toughness is equal to 7 minus that number.

rulings.text: The ability that sets its power and toughness is a characteristic-defining ability. This means it applies before any other effects that modify power and/or toughness.
The ability that lets you choose a new number is a triggered ability that triggers only once each upkeep.

cards.originalText:
As Shapeshifter enters the battlefield, choose a number between 0 and 7.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may choose a number between 0 and 7.
Shapeshifter's power is equal to the last chosen number and its toughness is equal to 7 minus that number.

cards.name: Sol Ring
cards.text: {T}: Add {C}{C}.
cards.originalText: {T}: Add {2} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Soldevi Golem
cards.text:
Soldevi Golem doesn't untap during your untap step.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may untap target tapped creature an opponent controls. If you do, untap Soldevi Golem.
cards.flavor: Slow and steady wins the race.

rulings.text: The ability to untap a creature can be used even if the Golem is already untapped.

cards.originalText:
Soldevi Golem doesn't untap during your untap step.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may untap target tapped creature an opponent controls. If you do, untap Soldevi Golem.

cards.name: Staff of Zegon
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Target creature gets -2/-0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Though Mishra was impressed by the staves Ashnod had created for Zegon's defense, he understood they only hinted at her full potential.
cards.originalText: {3}, {T}: Target creature gets -2/-0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Tablet of Epityr
cards.text: Whenever an artifact you control is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: Originally considered the work of Urza, this tablet was created by forgers seeking to imitate Urza's masterpieces.
cards.originalText: Whenever an artifact you control is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Tawnos's Wand
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Target creature with power 2 or less can't be blocked this turn.
cards.originalText: {2}, {T}: Target creature with power 2 or less is unblockable this turn.

cards.name: Tawnos's Weaponry
cards.text:
You may choose not to untap Tawnos's Weaponry during your untap step.
{2}, {T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 for as long as Tawnos's Weaponry remains tapped.
cards.flavor: When Urza's war machines became too costly, Tawnos's weaponry replaced them.
cards.originalText:
You may choose not to untap Tawnos's Weaponry during your untap step.
{2}, {T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 for as long as Tawnos's Weaponry remains tapped.

cards.name: Tetravus
cards.text:
Flying
Tetravus enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may remove any number of +1/+1 counters from Tetravus. If you do, create that many 1/1 colorless Tetravite artifact creature tokens. They each have flying and "This creature can't be enchanted."
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may exile any number of tokens created with Tetravus. If you do, put that many +1/+1 counters on Tetravus.

rulings.text: If the Tetravus is destroyed when the Tetravites are off the card, they are not destroyed, they are just orphaned.
Any +1/+1 counter which is on this card can be turned into a Tetravite token. It does not care where the +1/+1 counter came from.
Only Tetravites from this specific Tetravus may be used for the ability. Ones from a different Tetravus can't.
This card now has two upkeep-triggered abilities. Its controller chooses the order they are put on the stack, and thus the order in which they resolve each upkeep.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Tetravus enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it. 
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may remove any number of +1/+1 counters from Tetravus. If you do, put that many 1/1 colorless Tetravite artifact creature tokens onto the battlefield. They each have flying and "This creature can't be enchanted."
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may exile any number of tokens put onto the battlefield with Tetravus. If you do, put that many +1/+1 counters on Tetravus.

cards.name: Time Vault
cards.text:
Time Vault enters the battlefield tapped.
Time Vault doesn't untap during your untap step.
If you would begin your turn while Time Vault is tapped, you may skip that turn instead. If you do, untap Time Vault.
{T}: Take an extra turn after this one.

rulings.text: If multiple "extra turn" effects resolve in the same turn, take them in the reverse of the order that the effects resolved.

The choice of whether or not to skip a turn is made as that turn would begin, and only if Time Vault is tapped at that time. If you choose to skip your turn, Time Vault untaps before anything else happens in the next turn.
This wording means that you no longer end up skipping multiple turns if you find a way to activate the ability multiple times.

cards.originalText:
Time Vault enters the battlefield tapped.
Time Vault doesn't untap during your untap step.
If you would begin your turn while Time Vault is tapped, you may skip that turn instead. If you do, untap Time Vault.
{T}: Take an extra turn after this one.

cards.name: Triassic Egg
cards.text:
{3}, {T}: Put a hatchling counter on Triassic Egg.
Sacrifice Triassic Egg: Choose one —
• You may put a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield. Activate this ability only if two or more hatchling counters are on Triassic Egg.
• Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. Activate this ability only if two or more hatchling counters are on Triassic Egg.

rulings.text: You can use the sacrifice ability even if it is tapped.

cards.originalText:
{3}, {T}: Put a hatchling counter on Triassic Egg. 
Remove two hatchling counters from Triassic Egg, Sacrifice Triassic Egg: You may put a creature card from your hand or graveyard onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Urza's Chalice
cards.text: Whenever a player casts an artifact spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: When sorely wounded or tired, Urza would often retreat to the workshops of his apprentices. They were greatly amazed at how much better he looked each time he took a sip of water.

rulings.text: This will not trigger on its own casting. It must be on the battlefield at the time the artifact is cast.

cards.originalText: Whenever a player casts an artifact spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Urza's Miter
cards.text: Whenever an artifact you control is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, if it wasn't sacrificed, you may pay {3}. If you do, draw a card.
cards.originalText: Whenever an artifact you control is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, if it wasn't sacrificed, you may pay {3}. If you do, draw a card.

cards.name: Vibrating Sphere
cards.text:
As long as it's your turn, creatures you control get +2/+0.
As long as it's not your turn, creatures you control get -0/-2.
cards.flavor:
"Unearthly and invisible fibers emanate from this sphere, entangling all who draw near."
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi Machinist

rulings.text: Any creature which is lowered below a toughness of 1 will die at the beginning of the upkeep step, since that is the first time State-Based Actions are checked.

cards.originalText:
As long as it's your turn, creatures you control get +2/+0.
As long as it's not your turn, creatures you control get -0/-2.

cards.name: Weakstone
cards.text: Attacking creatures get -1/-0.
cards.flavor: During the brothers' childhood, Tocasia took them to explore the sacred cave of Koilos. There, in the Hall of Tagsin, Mishra discovered the mysterious weakstone.

rulings.text: The -1/-0 applies to attacking creatures from all players.

cards.originalText: Attacking creatures get -1/-0.

cards.name: Yotian Soldier
cards.text: Vigilance
cards.flavor: After Kroog was destroyed while most of its defenders were at his side, Urza vowed that none of his allies would ever need to fear for their own defense again, even while laying siege to a city far from their homes.
cards.originalText: Vigilance

cards.name: Badlands
cards.text: ({T}: Add {B} or {R}.)

rulings.text: Land type changing effects that change a dual land's land type will remove the old land types completely. Text-changing effects that just change one of the two land types will leave the other type unaffected.
This card is a Mountain and a Swamp even while in the graveyard, library, or any other zone.
This has the mana abilities associated with both of its basic land types.
This has basic land types, but it isn't a basic land. Things that affect basic lands don't affect it. Things that affect basic land types do.

cards.name: Bayou
cards.text: ({T}: Add {B} or {G}.)

rulings.text: This has the mana abilities associated with both of its basic land types.
This has basic land types, but it isn't a basic land. Things that affect basic lands don't affect it. Things that affect basic land types do.

cards.name: City of Brass
cards.text:
Whenever City of Brass becomes tapped, it deals 1 damage to you.
{T}: Add one mana of any color.

rulings.text: The first ability triggers no matter how the land becomes tapped.

If you tap City of Brass while you are casting a spell or activating an ability, its ability will trigger and wait. When you finish casting that spell or activating that ability, City of Brass's triggered ability is put on the stack on top of it. City of Brass's ability will resolve first.

On the other hand, you can tap City of Brass, put its triggered ability on the stack, and then respond to that ability by casting an instant or activating an ability using that mana. In that case, the instant spell or activated ability will resolve first.

cards.originalText:
Whenever City of Brass becomes tapped, it deals 1 damage to you.
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
